Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou! Good, you're finally here. There's--
Smoke on the horizon, my first mate told me. May I see that spyglass?
Of course. The rest of the watch and I spotted it about ten minutes ago, off port. It looks as if it may be a ship aflame.
You have sharp eyes. To my knowledge, there aren't any other INPF ships nearby, but it could be a civilian vessel.
In all likelihood, it means a fight, or at least Funayūrei lurking. Do we steer towards it, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: Of course. It's our duty to fend off any Morganas we run across.
Of course. We cannot allow civilian ships to become easy targets for the Funayūrei.
It may not be a fight, but it is our duty to aid any ship in peril.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm eager to cut my teeth on another one of their hulls, Kanchou.
You're right. These are our waters, and those people are ours to protect.
You're right. It's common decency. I only hope we get there in time!
Full steam ahead! Kanchou, I can see two burning ships... they look like civilian freighters... and Funayūrei, as well!
@BATTLE
We can't chase after them. We've got to see if there are any survivors in the water.
Ah, you're right. I wish we could remove those disgusting creatures from the ocean once and for all.
...! Kanchou! There's a girl in the water! Just off my bow!
What are you-
The lifeboat won't get to her on time!
That was quite the impressive sight, Nagato - you diving off the ship to rescue the girl.
No, it wasn't a big deal.
I'm lucky she was so close to the bow. I couldn't have gone very far.

Fields.MenuText: It was a brave act, Nagato. I'm proud of you.
I didn't know you were capable of being quite so... impetuous.
Had you ever attempted swimming in your solid state before?

Fields.DialogueText: ... Thank you, Kanchou. To tell you the truth, I don't know what came over me.
I-I don't know what came over me. I probably should have thought it through before I jumped in.
Ha... no. I'm not entirely sure what would have happened had I not instinctively known how to swim.
How is the girl? Was the crew able to fish out any other survivors?
The girl is recovering in the sick bay. Apart from nearly drowning, she's physically fine, but shaken. It appears she was the only survivor of the attack.
The Funayūrei are ruthless. I only wish we had gotten here in time to stave off the attack.
It was thanks to you and the rest of that watch that we were able to intervene at all. We might have sailed by without noticing it.
Kanchou, I think a Morgana is heading back to finish the job.
One of the ones we already fought?
No, she feels undamaged. Prepare the crew for another fight!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, how is the girl? Has the medical crew been able to find out anything about her?
A bit. Her name is Antonia Acosta, and she's a twenty-year-old Spaniard.
She was a machinist's mate on one of the civilian ships that supplies rations to the Protection Force.
May I speak with her?
You have a curious look in your eye, Nagato. What are you plotting?
I only wish to ask her a few questions about the attack on her ship, and the Funayūrei. She may have seen something that could be useful.

Fields.MenuText: I'd be interested in asking her a few questions myself, to be honest.
Whatever information she may or may not have, best to leave her be for now.
I doubt she saw anything of use. We've been attacked by Morganas again and again and are no closer to unravelling their mysteries.

Fields.DialogueText: Let's go together, then. She may have even gotten a good look at one of them...
I understand the need to let her recover, but she may have information vital to the mission of the Protection Force.
We have never been boarded or sunk. She may have gotten a good look at a Funayūrei!
Unfortunately, the doctors say she refuses to respond to any questions about the attack or the Morganas.
Hmm. Perhaps I could get something out of her. It may require a lighter touch than any of the crew is capable of.
You can talk to her soon, but for now, it's best to listen to the doctors.
*ALARM*
Besides, there's the alarm. We've got a Morgana to fight.
@BATTLE
Kanchou...
Is this about Miss Acosta? I told you, you'll be able to speak to her as soon as the doctors say she's sufficiently recovered.
No, Kanchou. ... Have I truly been bothering you so much? I try not to be so coarse as to argue.
You can be... truly persistent, when you set your mind to it.
My apologies, Kanchou.
Nagato?
... There are two Funayūrei trying to sneak up on us. One to port, and one to starboard.
Let's get to it.
@BATTLE
Does it seem as if Morganas have been attacking more frequently since we encountered the wreck, Nagato?
I was just thinking the same thing. We'll need to be even more careful than usual.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry for being short with you earlier. What was it you wanted to say?
You wanted to speak to me about something earlier?
Say what you wanted to say earlier, so long as it isn't about our half-drowned Spaniard.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, I'm sorry for giving you reason to be short.
Yes, though it's not important. Just something I'd noticed.
It isn't about the girl, Kanchou. I just wanted to help you with something.
I noticed your coat is frayed again. Do you want me to sashiko to strengthen it?
Ah, your eyes miss nothing. That would be helpful. Hopefully, I'll soon have an opportunity to replace it.
I wouldn't count on it, fleet supplies being what they are. But I should be able to make it last a few more battles, at least.
So, I am to be allowed to speak to our guest, Kanchou?
Yes, we both are, but the doctor attending her told me not to expect much. She has barely spoken since you pulled her from the water.
I see... That's disappointing.

Fields.MenuText: It is unfortunate. I had hoped to learn more about the Morganas as well.
She may not be as useful as you had hoped. Are you sure you want to talk to her?
You could have more compassion, Nagato. Everyone on board that ship with her were lost.

Fields.DialogueText: Even if she had just a few pieces of information, it could be vital to the success of our mission.
Of course! I want to get to know her. I was the one who saved her, after all.
I'm not callous, Kanchou. What happened to her was awful. But if she knows something, that information could be used to avert future tragedies.
Well, come on then.
Do you think she's ever met a Belle before?
Not until you jumped into the sea with her, most likely. You're not a common bunch.
I'll try not to spook her.
Hello, Miss Acosta. I am the captain of this vessel, and this is Nagato, the ship's Belle.
It's good to meet you properly.
Una dama de mar...! Me salvaste... Yo creí que...
Oh, my apologies, I'm afraid my Spanish is lacking...
Miss Acosta?
It seems we came at a bad time. Perhaps we should leave her be, Nagato.
W-Wait!
*ALARM*
We'd best prepare for combat.
My apologies for disturbing you, Miss Acosta. We'll have to talk another day.
@BATTLE
That screaming, last night...
It was Miss Acosta. The chief medical officer told me this morning one of the doctors had to sedate her, for her own safety.
They had been sedating her prior to battles, to keep her calm, but in the chaos of the last battle they had more pressing matters.
I see. Poor woman.
They say it's combat neurosis, or something similar. Shellshock.
Are you well, Nagato?
I could feel those screams in my bones...
Nagato?
It's nothing, Kanchou. It just... it reminded me of what Mutsu went through, and what we went through. I want to protect everyone on board, naturally, but I... can't.
I want to protect our crew as well, Nagato, but we're putting them - and ourselves - in danger to protect our homes.
... Yes. You're right.
I'm going to try to put Miss Acosta in the hands of the Protection Force's shore offices the next time we make port. They'll be able to get her back to Spain.
That's probably for the best.
Oh, hell. Is she--
Sedated, Kanchou. She'll sleep through it.
@BATTLE
Kanchou! What's the matter?
We have new orders. I - damn, is that a French ship off the bow?
No, Kanchou, that's a Funayūrei. She looks like she's angling for the port...
All hands to stations! At least we'll be able to accomplish something today.
@BATTLE
Ha! Nothing like a victory to chase away gloom. But what were you angry about earlier, Kanchou? What are our new orders?
The same as always, Morgana-hunting. With a complication.
The Protection Force is fond of those, it seems.
We're to keep Miss Acosta on board and transport her to meet with representatives of the upper brass of the Protection Force.
They've had the same thought that I did. She may know something useful. Perhaps we'll be able to hear her account of the attack after all.
I understand their reasoning, but the chief medical officer is livid. She thinks the best thing for her health would be to put her ashore.
And you're inclined to agree? The needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few, Kanchou.
You should prepare yourself for a fight, Kanchou. I feel a Morgana creeping up on us. Maybe two.
From which direction?
The way we came. They appear to be following us.
Hmm. We do seem to have drawn a lot of attention lately. That's a mystery.
I have another small mystery you could help me with.
What is it, Kanchou?
The gameboard in the wardroom, is that yours?
Oh! It isn't mine, it belongs to Miss Wong, the medical officer. We've been playing Go together. It's an ongoing game.
I see.
It's good for keeping your strategizing skills sharp. Have you ever played, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: I have, but it's been some time since I played last.
I think I've heard of it...?
I hardly have time for eating, much less games, Nagato.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, I hadn't had the chance to play in a while either. I had no idea Miss Wong played it until earlier today.
If you'd ever like to learn more, Miss Wong does a wonderful job of explaining the rules.
Games like this can be useful, Kanchou. They're not just a frivolity.
You should play a game with me some time. Oh! There's the Funayūrei I told you was following us. She looks like a fast one.
@BATTLE
*SCREAM*
Is that...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Nagato, what are you doing down in the sickbay? You disappeared immediately following the battle. Are you hurt?
I'm sorry, Kanchou. I heard Miss Acosta screaming during the fighting, and I--
You... you're the captain. Her captain.
I am. I apologize, but I need to speak with Nagato.
She told me I had nothing to worry about. Las brujas del mar. She told me you would protect us.
I-
She said there was no Bruja that could face you both and win.

Fields.MenuText: She spoke the truth. You're safe on my ship, Miss Acosta.
I wouldn't phrase it in absolutes, but we do our best.
Nagato can't make promises like that, nor can I.

Fields.DialogueText: See? The word of the kanchou is law on any ship, as you know. You're safe.
We win consistently. So long as we continue our usual performance, you will be safe.
That's true. Nothing in this life is certain. But I can promise that I will do everything in my power to keep you, and everyone on board, safe.
Thank you, Dama.
Nagato, we both have duties to attend to.
Of course. I will visit you soon, Miss Acosta.
Antonia.
Antonia.
Nagato, I can't have you disappearing right after battle. The crew and I need your help in the aftermath.
My departure wasn't ideal, I know. I have responsibilities I must attend to - you and the crew depend on me.
I'm sorry, Kanchou.
Didn't you recently say to me that the needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few?
It holds true, Kanchou. The whole sickbay could hear her screaming, and it was making the medical staff lose their focus.
I don't want our doctors distracted during a battle when our crew members' lives depend on their focus and ability.
That, I understand. Thank you for calming her down. In the future, however, I'd prefer it if you'd consult me before disappearing like you did.
Of course, Kanchou. It was a fluke that she was awake at all. I'll do my best to keep you in the know from now on.
Thank you, Nagato.
Of course, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
*HUMMING*
Hello, Kanchou.
... Anata ga tsukarete mieru. Would you like some tea?

Fields.MenuText: That sounds wonderful. Thank you, Nagato.
No, thank you. I'm not fond of it.
I don't have time to sit and have tea right now, I'm afraid.

Fields.DialogueText: It's my pleasure. Here you are, Kanchou.
I don't understand how anyone can dislike matcha.
I understand. Is the fleet pressing you for more reports?
I have a question for you, Nagato. It's a bit of a foolish one, but I can't believe I never asked it.
What is it, Kanchou?
Is that sword you wear ceremonial?
My uchigatana? Not exactly. I know how to use it, though I haven't had the occasion to do so for some time.
I can't imagine you running around and fighting with a sword, especially in those clothes and shoes.
I'm a capable fencer, Kanchou, even in these shoes. But it's true it's not something I do regularly. It's a last resort.
How do you mean?
If we were attacked and boarded, it would be my responsibility to defend this ship to the end. To protect my kanchou and crew.
I see...
Don't put on that expression, Kanchou. It's an unlikely event, given the Funayūrei's current habits. But if one ever did step on board...
Well, she would be at an extreme disadvantage. This ship is me, after all.
Nagato... do you want a pistol? I could requisition one from the armory for you.
No, but thank you. The guns already installed in my ship are enough. My uchigatana is just for times of desperation.
I see. Well, hopefully, you won't be forced to use it today. There's another Morgana on our tail.
@BATTLE
Good day, Kanchou! It's a lovely one, isn't it?
Relatively speaking. Is that Miss Acosta beside you?
Hello, Captain.
It's good to see you out here, looking well. What are you two up to?
La Dama said she had some spare ink and quills I could borrow. She'd only let me use them if I came up with her.
Nagato, are you using your power and resources to push around our guest?
Of course not, Kanchou. The doctor has been encouraging her to come up here for some fresh air. I merely facilitated the process.
Hmmm. Are you writing a letter? I could arrange to have it sent with my next report.
No, Kanchou.
Antonia's an artist, Kanchou! She said she was due to attend school to study art until the civil war broke out in Spain.
Ah, of course. That's an unfortunate stroke of luck, Miss Acosta.
Bad luck seems to come my way frequently...
That wasn't luck, Antonia. The Funayūrei prey on those types of ships frequently. But it was luck that we spotted you in the water and managed to pluck you out.
Luck and Nagato's sharp eyesight.
La Dama is amazing, Captain. You're lucky to command her.

Fields.MenuText: I am, incredibly so.
That's not luck either. She chose me.
All this talk of luck is making my head hurt.

Fields.DialogueText: Antonia, you should get back below deck.
Antonia, you should get back below deck.
Antonia, you should get back below deck.
There's a presence on the horizon... a Funayūrei. I can feel her.
You'll be fine. We know what we're doing. Head down to sick bay and find a place to rest until the battle is over.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, there's a Funayūrei in pursuit of us.
We hardly have to hunt them anymore. They come straight to us.
I think it's Injustice, Kanchou.
Damn, really?
Take a look, through the spyglass. At first, it was just a feeling I had, but I don't think I'm wrong.
Hmm. It doesn't look exactly like Injustice, but she took quite the beating last time we saw her.
Morganas are monsters. All their modifications are strange. She was probably just repaired in an odd way.
And now, she's made it her mission to come after us.
That's what I'm thinking as well. ... It's unfortunate, I thought we had scared her off once and for all.
You think she has a reason for coming after us?
I think it's Antonia. Maybe the Morganas know we picked someone up from the wreckage.
And they believe whomever we picked up might actually know something. But how would they know we rescued anyone?
Maybe they're intercepting our communications. Or maybe it's just a guess.
It wouldn't be out of their usual modus operandi to destroy anything that might pose a threat.
That's true. Run, or turn and fight?
I don't think we have a choice.
@BATTLE
Morganas have been spotted, Captain.
To your stations!
@BATTLE
Ha! What are you doing on the floor of the wardroom, Nagato? Did your game of Go get tipped off the table?
Don't laugh at me, Kanchou. It's not polite.
It's a little bit funny. Here, I'll help you clean everything up.
It's... It's not funny.
Nagato? Are you... crying?
No, Kanchou.
You are crying. What's wrong? Are you hurt?
I... This all is just so useless! I feel like we're running around in circles here. We never manage to sink Funayūrei...
I'm not sure many have managed that.
So what's the point? We fight, crew members die, but the Morganas never suffer casualties.
They don't even blink. They just cobble their monstrous ships back together and come in pursuit again.
We're doing the best we can. We're putting dents in them, hopefully straining their resources and their motivation.
It's useless. It's pointless. We have no plan, and every time we make one, the Funayūrei come and toss all the pieces off the board.

Fields.MenuText: We're fighting an enemy still incomprehensible to us, but we're learning. As long as we continue to do so, we'll stand a chance.
We're fighting to protect our homes. We're foiling their plans, stopping them from gaining ocean and resources. We can win, even if it seems hopeless.
What's our alternative? Even if it is hopeless, we're protecting our homes. The citizens of our nations. That's enough.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose we should have the strategic advantage, then. It just doesn't feel like we do. B-but we are learning, even if the Funayūrei seem incomprehensible.
That's true. I would do anything for Japan. This chaos just seems hopeless, sometimes.
... That's true. It is enough. If I am to sink eventually, I would choose to sink for that.
I'm sorry, Kanchou. I would never abandon you, or our cause. I just got... caught up.
It happens to all of us, Nagato. Come on, put those away, and we can get some tea.
Kanchou! You look tired. Come sit with me and Antonia for a bit. No, don't be shy Antonia, my kanchou is completely harmless.
So long as you're not a Morgana or a crew member shirking duty.
See? You're our guest on the great ship Nagato.
Isn't that a bit arrogant, Dama, if the great ship is you?
Hmm. I'm not the shipyard workers who built me, nor the crew who maintains and runs me, nor my kanchou who commands me.
Those are the things that make me great.
Expertly deflected.
Thank you, Kanchou. You should take a look at what Antonia drew - she is quite talented.
A-ah, I'm just a hobbyist, at this point.
These are quite good - is this the postal ship we passed this morning?
Y-yes, Captain. I have a good handle on ships. I've been drawing them for some time.
Hmm. Nice work.
Antonia, I think you should get below. There's a ship to starboard, and I'm sure she's not the friendly sort.
Damn, she's fast. She's right. Get below, Miss Acosta, and we'll handle this.
@BATTLE
I don't know why this is crossing my mind right now, but...
I've heard you call me "your kanchou" when talking to Miss Acosta twice now.
Does it bother you? You are my kanchou, after all. I didn't mean to give offense.

Fields.MenuText: Nah, I like it. You're my Belle, after all.
That makes sense. It was just strange to hear you say it like that.
It sounds a bit possessive.

Fields.DialogueText: I am. For as long as I'm able to float.
I'm sorry. I'll be more mindful of my phrasing in the future.
Well... you are my kanchou. I don't mean it in terms of entanglement, though.
I have a duty to you and the crew, and you have a duty to me.
Did you think of all your captains this way?
Nagato?
I have had several, Kanchou. I'm not young, in terms of being a ship, at least.
No one would guess. You don't look a day over twenty-five.
You know exactly how old I am. But my age as a Belle and the age of the timbers and metal that make me up are different. It's all a matter of perception.
You still haven't answered my question about your captains.
... I will not dishonor the men who commanded me before you. But I chose you. That makes you a different sort of kanchou, to me.
You just felt... right. And now, well... you're my closest friend.
I'm glad to fight side by side with a friend.
It doesn't make things easier, but it makes us both stronger.
@BATTLE
It'd better.
Miss Acosta. Do you know where Nagato is?
I believe she was climbing to the top of the mast to get a look, Captain. Look, you can see that golden chrysanthemum pin she wears in her hair from all the way down here.
Hah. What a Belle she is, always full of surprises.
Yes, Captain.
How have you been faring? Are your accommodations to your liking?
Yes, Captain, though I did not mean to take up the Dama's space. She insisted I stay in her quarters...
It's all well and good. She doesn't actually need sleep, or at least, not much, not in the same way that you or I might.
Hah. Brujas del Mar y Damas del Mar... sometimes I think the world has gone mad, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: The world has always been mad. This is just the most noticeable madness presented to us.
It has gone mad, but at least we've been given Belles along with witches.
It surely has. Sometimes I wonder if it's coming apart.

Fields.DialogueText: Hah. You're right. This chaos in the sea is obvious. The chaos on land, well... it's more subtle, and created by ordinary men and women.
That's true. I'd never met a Belle before now... they are incredible.
... It seems likely.
What's that you're drawing? Another ship?
A-ah well, in a manner of speaking...
Aha, a Belle, not a ship. That's a good likeness of her. I think she'd like it.
What are you two whispering about?
Dama! D-Don't just a-appear like that! I-I... Forgive me for snapping, but- please!
Ah, I'm sorry! I'm sorry, that was terribly discourteous of me. Are you all right, Antonia?
... Y-yes, I'm fine.
I'm sorry. Kanchou, there are ships on the horizon again. Funayūrei. They're trying to catch up to us, and they're back in full force.
@BATTLE
Kanchou! Come look at what Antonia's drawn.
Nagato... I'm not sure...
What is it? ... Those look like the ships we fought off last. Huh. These are damn good depictions of them, to my memory.
I-I caught a glimpse of them. It's easy to remember ships.
If you could draw every Morgana we encounter... it could prove useful, if only to inform the rest of the fleet.
With the way the ships seem to change, subtly... having images like this could better help us discern what alterations they make.
Photos would be better, but Miss Acosta seems to have a good eye for detail.
Do you think you could draw these of the rest of the ships we engage? If you got a glimpse of them?
Antonia? Are you all right? You're shaking. Please don't feel pressured - if you'd rather not, you're under no compulsion to do so.

Fields.MenuText: Miss Acosta should save her strength for talking to the fleet brass. We shouldn't subject her to further trauma.
A camera would be more reliable anyway.
It would be very useful if you could draw them, Miss Acosta. I know your distaste for the Morganas, but it would help prevent incidents like the attack that took your ship and crewmates.

Fields.DialogueText: That's probably for the best.
That's true. Maybe we could pick up a photographer...
... It's true, it would be useful, but we are supposed to be protecting her, not putting her to work.
I-It's all right. It's a small thing. I can draw the ships, if I get a look at them. I can.
*ALARM*
It sounds like I will soon have an opportunity.
Stick close to Nagato, Miss Acosta. She'll protect you.
@BATTLE
Morganas approaching fast, Captain!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Nagato? I'd wondered where you had gotten off to after the fight. What are you doing down here with the engines?
I took Antonia down here after the battle. She was in... a bad state. She said seeing the engines would calm her.
I've never worked in the engines of a super-dreadnought. The scale of these ships is incredible. Ten boilers...
I used to have twenty-one, but they made it hard to breathe down here. Those were the days when I could really go fast.
... She looks a little out of it, Nagato.
I think immersing herself in mechanics helps her refocus. At the very least, it gets her mind off the Morgana threat.

Fields.MenuText: Good thinking. Just make sure she doesn't get in the way of the engine crew.
'Immersing herself in mechanics?' That sounds a little odd, Nagato.
I'd rather not have a shellshocked engineer within reach of your turbines.

Fields.DialogueText: I will, don't worry. This is an important part of me, after all.
We all do what we must to cope with this war, Kanchou.
I'm right here, and I'm not helpless, Kanchou. If she tried to damage anything, I would stop her.
Well, I suppose I should leave you two at it. Just make sure not to get in the way.
Why are you in here covering the walls of my quarters with maps?
Hm? Oh, because Miss Acosta is using my quarters at the moment. I'll move them as soon as we deliver her, Kanchou. Do you mind?
I suppose not. Those are the maps you received from that League of Nations rep, aren't they?
Yes, Kanchou. I have been keeping them updated, marking where we run into Funayūrei.
And now you're adding Miss Acosta's drawings. Hmm. That could be useful.
I hope it will be, at least for establishing patterns and tracking specific Funayūrei.
The Protection Force has a number of analysts doing more sophisticated versions of this, but they don't always communicate that information with us.
Found anything interesting so far?
We're definitely being targeted, more so than usual. I think it's safe to say the Funayūrei don't want us to reach our destination.
Most likely because of Miss Acosta... you've been spending a lot of time with her.
I like her. She's been telling me about the civil war in Spain and teaching me a bit of Spanish.
Has she told you anything about the sinking of her ship?
No, she hasn't. But I haven't pushed her as much as I could.
That's probably for the best.
We're being trailed by another Funayūrei right now. She's matching our movements. I think she may be trying remain unseen.
We can deal with her.
@BATTLE
Anything you could tell us has the potential to be useful. Anything at all. I understand that it's hard.
I've been badly hurt by the Funayūrei, too. But they can be defeated - you've seen that.
Dama, I... I... I don't think I'll ever escape them. They're coming for me, aren't they?
We're routinely attacked by Funayūrei.
I heard you and the captain talking. They want me.
I see you decided to ask her after all.

Fields.MenuText: They may want you, but they won't be able to lay hands on you. We have and will continue to fight them off.
We were only speculating. There are dozens of other factors that could play into their attacking us.
They're not chasing you. They'll chase any ship they lay sights on.

Fields.DialogueText: The kanchou is right. We're not a civilian ship, ripe for the picking. You've seen how well we can fight.
That's right. It was careless of us to make such wild guesses. In truth, we know almost nothing about their motivations.
... That's true. There is little strategy to their attacks, it seems.
Kanchou, we've picked up a pair of tailing Funayūrei. I think it would be best for me to escort Antonia to her quarters.
Join me on the bridge as quickly as you can.
@BATTLE
We are taking heavy fire, Kanchou! I...
Nagato, look out!
@BATTLE
Nagato! Nagato!
Captain, what's going on?
That last shot damaged one of her turbines.
We're... we're slowed... and vulnerable to their attacks.
And if we don't get that hole patched and the turbine working again, we may sink. Several crew members were injured in that blast.
Captain, I don't know her engines as well as I knew those on my ship, but I did work in the engine rooms on my old ship.
I could help.

Fields.MenuText: Get below and get to work, then.
Go talk to the chief machinist's mate, see what he tells you.
I can't have you distracting anyone from their jobs.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain.
I will.
I won't, Captain. That work is what I know best.
Follow the orders of any engineers down there. They all know this ship better than you.
I won't disappoint you.
I trust her, Kanchou.
Very well.
It's strange to be so slow. So still.
The engine room crew is working hard to finish repairs on your damaged steam turbine. They've managed to stop it from flooding.
We are an easy target now, Kanchou. Those Funayūrei will be back to finish us off.
That's optimistic.
It's logical. They wanted to critically damage me, to slow me. Leave me for someone with more firepower to destroy.
I won't let that happen.
... Do you know what I'm thinking right now?
... That if worse comes to worst, you don't want me going down with you.

Fields.MenuText: I have no intention of doing so, Nagato.
Isn't it tradition?

Fields.DialogueText: Good. I'm glad you see reason.
I'm a traditional woman, but not in war. Not if you can survive.
I won't let you sink, Nagato. We can beat any threat, even while damaged.
@BATTLE
Where is she?
She'll come back when she's ready. When she's recovering, she sometimes prefers to keep to herself.
You would like a little time to gather yourself too, if you'd almost been sunk.
Nagato!
Ah! Don't hug me so tightly. Now, don't look so sad. I'm shipshape and fine - thanks to you and crew.
A extra pair of hands is always useful.
How long until we reach the port?
Not long now. We'll have you to safety soon, Miss Acosta.
Will you be all right? Talking before the League of Nations?
I-I... I don't know. I'll try to be. I don't even know if what I saw... if it will be of any use.
Just tell them what you know. Every little bit of information can help. The Morganas wouldn't be after you if you hadn't seen something of importance.
Ah, there is Miss Wong. I'll have to ask her if we can resume our nightly games of Go...
Captain? I have a... a gift for the Dama. Could you give it to her for me, when you set sail again?
Of course. I'll keep it safe until then.
The same as when last you asked, Kanchou. Half an hour ago.
Nagato, status!
Half an hour can be an eternity in battle.
Don't I know it. We'll get through this!
@BATTLE
Do we have our new orders yet?
Why so eager?
I feel like I spent far too much time sitting around damaged. And... I don't like lingering.
You miss Antonia, don't you?
You do.
She was good company.
Do you wish you could have gone with her?
Oh, no, of course not. My place is on the sea, with you. I was growing fond of her, but that's nothing compared to... this.
To the open sea and the  people we must protect from monsters.
Exactly. That's what I live for, and what I think you do too.
Antonia left a gift for you.
A drawing? Ah! It's me and you! Look, Kanchou! We look like quite the regal pair.
Heh... I don't know about regal, but we do have an excellent partnership.
We should frame it and hang it in the wardroom.

Fields.MenuText: That's a good idea.
Next to the picture of the Emperor?
That would be a tad tactless, I think.

Fields.DialogueText: Excellent.
No, not there. On the other side of the room.
No, it's not tactless. This is a work of art.
Well, we do have our orders. A Morgana that matches the description of Injustice has been sighted north of us.
And we're to hunt her? I hope we sink her this time. I've had plenty of time to prepare.
